However, if allowed to divide fractions then every person would receive around 488,889 portions including parts of whole oranges. direct_answer.text:
To calculate the amount of oranges per person when shared equally, we simply divide the total number of oranges by the number of people:  
Total Oranges / Total People = Number Of Oranges Each Person Gets  
So let’s consider only seven as our total numbers(the actual question asked about seventh round), which represents neither friend nor juris :   
Oranges Per Round/Person=Seventeen thousand eight hundred fortyfive divided by Seven equals Two Thousand One Hundred Forty-three Point Zero Eight Nine Three Sevens Fifteen Fourth Rounds Result Is TwentyOne Peculiar
